001package net.tvburger.jdl.model;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.Array;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.NumberTypeAgnostic;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
007
008/**
009 * The {@link #estimate(N[])} method defines the contract for mapping input values
010 * to output values according to a specific estimation algorithm.
011 * Different implementations may use linear, non-linear, or domain-specific (symbolic AI) logic.
012 */
013@DomainObject
014@Strategy(Strategy.Role.INTERFACE)
015public interface EstimationFunction<N extends Number> extends NumberTypeAgnostic<N> {
016
017    /**
018     * Applies the estimation algorithm to the given input vector.
019     *
020     * @param inputs an array of input values (e.g., features, signals)
021     * @return an array of output values computed by the estimation function
022     */
023    Array<N> estimate(Array<N> inputs);
024
025    /**
026     * Returns the <b>arity</b> of this function, i.e. the number of inputs
027     * (independent variables or features) it expects.
028     * <p>
029     * For example:
030     * <ul>
031     *   <li>A univariate function {@code f(x)} has arity 1.</li>
032     *   <li>A multivariate function {@code f(x, y, z)} has arity 3.</li>
033     *   <li>In machine learning, this corresponds to the input feature dimension.</li>
034     * </ul>
035     *
036     * @return the number of inputs (arity) this function accepts
037     */
038    int arity();
039
040
041    /**
042     * Returns the <b>co-arity</b> of this function, i.e. the number of outputs
043     * (dependent variables or results) it produces.
044     * <p>
045     * For example:
046     * <ul>
047     *   <li>A scalar-valued function {@code f(x, y)} → ℝ has co-arity 1.</li>
048     *   <li>A vector-valued function {@code f(x, y)} → ℝ² has co-arity 2.</li>
049     *   <li>In machine learning, this corresponds to the output dimension
050     *       (e.g., number of labels or regression targets).</li>
051     * </ul>
052     *
053     * @return the number of outputs (co-arity) this function produces
054     */
055    int coArity();
056
057}
